top_comments.comment: This looks great!  I have two suggestions: 1. Place every thing under the bed into black storage boxes(or just paint or cover existing boxes in black paper/fabric) and 2.  Paint a 1x2 piece of wood the same color as the wall.  Stick it to the wall next to/behind the bed and buy a clip-on reading light to clip onto it.  That was an excellent transformation!!

comments_since_last_sample.body: This makeover was gorgeous! The colour palette, the new pieces, the DIYs 😍😍😍 Whoever invented those command hooks, needs an award! I thought u were gonna decorate the bed as a day bed vibe, that would've been fun but great job team!
Absurd she can't drill holes

the lounge and entry way are lovely here! i found the bed didn't work thou, her pillows she had before were so beautiful and more expensive looking than the final result. and the desk chair seems more for the reveal than for practical working from home comfort which was something she had in her brief. but overall some great problem solves in this space!
Love the make over, but what happen to the kitchen and bathroom being the apartment is so small. I’m sure she could of had help in these areas.
Now THAT'S WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT GIRL!!!!  Well done team AG!
No kitchen?
I was like no no no how HOW??? will she pull this one off and then BOOM! Team AG for the win. Feel better Xico
Beautiful

I love these videos. But speaking from experience that desk from Ikea is literal trash. The quality of it is horrible. The legs are not sturdy at all. It was thrown away in a matter of a few months (used it as long as possible because I hate wasting money).

Hi, you did a great job. The red bedspread is perfect. I get your reasoning for not adding a divider at the end of the bed but I think some type of shelving or frame with a gauzy material would have worked.
So cosy! You are so talented and have a breat team, so entertanting🤗 Get well soon Chico.

This looks great!  I have two suggestions: 1. Place every thing under the bed into black storage boxes(or just paint or cover existing boxes in black paper/fabric) and 2.  Paint a 1x2 piece of wood the same color as the wall.  Stick it to the wall next to/behind the bed and buy a clip-on reading light to clip onto it.  That was an excellent transformation!!
I love this small space makeover.  Now, there is color  and pattern to delight the eyes everywhere.  Not too much, just right. This is a 10 out of 10, for me!
Stunning!!!
I am consistently amazed at your creativity! I love the outcome! I also always appreciate the camera work at the end that allows the viewer to take it all in from all the angles!
We love James soooooooomuch!!!! Also you did a great job with this make over!!
Excellent job
Very well done. The bedspread color makes the space.
Do you know a vent is for airflow, right?
Wow! What a difference! Great job :-)
